body_html:
model downloaded by default: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/download-models.gradle

I wanted to know how to reduce input image to speed-up processing?

I did something like this for tiny yolo (TF Yolo Detector), I reduced input resolution (96x96) to get more fps (of course it reduces quality for recognition but I also use different methods to crop interested parts of image for processing, not just whole frame from camera)
body_text:
model downloaded by default: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/download-models.gradle
I wanted to know how to reduce input image to speed-up processing?
I did something like this for tiny yolo (TF Yolo Detector), I reduced input resolution (96x96) to get more fps (of course it reduces quality for recognition but I also use different methods to crop interested parts of image for processing, not just whole frame from camera)
body:
model downloaded by default: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/download-models.gradle

I wanted to know how to reduce input image to speed-up processing?

I did something like this for tiny yolo (TF Yolo Detector), I reduced input resolution (96x96) to get more fps (of course it reduces quality for recognition but I also use different methods to crop interested parts of image for processing, not just whole frame from camera)
